intro: Centaurea aetaliae, commonly known as the Aetna thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple or pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often found in mountainous areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea aetaliae is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
